column4: what would cause dhcp to over ride a static ip manually set through editing /etc/network/interfaces
what would cause dhcp to over ride a static ip manually set through editing /etc/network/interfaces
you sure the file hasn't been overwritten?
positive
don't know why it would be ignored - you can   sudo /etc/init.d networking restart   to see if the file is used
its not ignored per say what appears to happen is when i restart networking the static is applied as expected but when the dhcp lease expires it renews it ignoring the static
can you paste /etc/network/interfaces?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/9356/
that looks right
why, with a static ip address, do you have a dhcp lease?
i had this problem in fedora befor i switched and had to disable network-manager to get it to stop using dhcp, as far as i can tel network-manager is not installed on 8.04 correct?
no clue..... i dont want one
it is installed - in control center I think
any hints on how to manage it via cli..... not running a gui on this box
I use the interfaces file for that...
locate doesnt yield anything named network-manager
that's a gui thing - and you have no gui - is it something with your router resetting or similar?
why would the router be forcing dhcp requests?
now that you mention it though  this did start happening shortly after replacing my old router
never had your issue - looking for clues
there you go
........ im totaly confused by that though... i mean time line matches up .... but that confuses me to the point of taking a shotgun to my computer
shoot the router not the comp
i need a new one of both =P
